title: Chorus broadband connections edge higher
text:
Chorus broadband connections edge higher 
Monday 19 Oct 2015 1:50 p.m. 
By Paul McBeth 
Telecommunications network operator Chorus increased broadband connections 0.9 percent in the September quarter as more customers switched to higher-speed fibre products. 
Total broadband connections increased to 1.22 million as at September 30 from 1.21 million three months earlier, it said. 
Fibre connections jumped 23 percent to 92,000, of which 86,000 were in the government-sponsored ultrafast broadband areas, indicating a 17 percent uptake of the high-speed internet service. 
Chorus's fixed-line connections shrank 1 percent to 1.78m in the quarter as the company removed dual copper-fibre lines and fibre uptake outside the firm's UFB areas grew, and as more customers ditched their landlines to take 'naked' broadband services. 
The company won the lion's share of the government's programme to roll-out a fibre telecommunications network to 75 percent of the country, a target which has since been extended to 80 percent. 
NZN
